alert.note: Alert for Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 18 at 4:05PM CDT until May 18 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL ETOWAH COUNTY... At 405 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain and flooding across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Hokes Bluff, Glencoe, Gadsden Mall, Noccalula Falls, Neely Henry Lake, Southside, Big Wills Creek, Gadsden Steam Plant, Gadsden Water Works, Northside and Gadsden Municipal Airport. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
